intro: Godetia lassenensis var. albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, white-veined stems and clusters of small, showy yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
